alert.note: Alert for Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 26 at 4:39AM PST until December 27 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Accumulations of 4 to 8 inches, with higher amounts up to 12 inches at higher elevations. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties including Dorris, Macdoel, and Tulelake. Impacts are expected for all area roads and highways. * WHEN...Until 7 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact holiday travel and the morning commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties
